Bosom friend (intimate friend, a very close friend, অন্তরঙ্গ বন্ধু) Salil is my bosom friend. )
Breathe one's last (die, মারা যাওয়া) The old man breathes his last on Sunday last.
Bone of contention (matter of dispute, subject of quarrel/disagreement, বিবাদের বিষয়) The paternal property is the bone of contention between the two brothers.
Bring to book (to punish, শাস্তি দেওয়া) He should be brought to book for his misconduct.
Bring to light (make open, disclose, প্রকাশ করা) The inquiry brought to light some startling facts.
Brown study (fit of reverie, day dream, দিবা স্বপ্ন) He is now absorbed in brown study.



Build castles in the air (indulge in idle vision, আকাশ কুসুম রচনা করা; make improbable plans, ঘটা প্রায় অসম্ভব এমন পরিকল্পনা করা ) Don't idle away your time in building castles in the air.
Burn the midnight oil (study till the late night,অধিক রাত্রি জেগে পড়াশুনা করা; work late into the night, অনেক রাত অবধি কাজ করা;) You will not have to burn midnight oil before examination.
Burning question (matter of strong debate, তীব্র বিতর্কের বিষয়) The problem of the dowry system is the burning question of the day.
By all means (in all possible ways,সর্বপ্রকারে, সর্ব উপায়ে) Try to do it by all means.
By and by (soon, before long, শীঘ্রই) He will come here by and by.
By and large (mostly, , mainly, প্রধানত) People in our village are by and large farmers.
By chance (by accident, দৈবাৎ, হঠাৎ, আকস্মিক) I met him on the way by chance.
By fits and starts (irregularly, অনিয়মিতভাবে, মাঝে মাঝে) He works by fits and starts.
By far (out and away, in all respects, সর্বাংশে ) He is by far the best boy in the class.
By the by (in course of talking, প্রসঙ্গক্রমে) By the by I came to know that he was ill.

beneath  once dignity (derogatory, অসম্মানজনক) It is beneath my dignity to accept that post.
Between the devil and deep sea, Between two fires (between two equal dangers, in difficult situation,উভয় সঙ্কট ) I am between the devil and deep sea between my friends.
Bear away the bell (to be the first, সর্বপ্রথম হওয়া ) Will she be able to bear away the bell?
Bee line (straight away, সোজা পথ ) Our school is one mile away from here on the bee line.
Beauty sleep (premature sleep, প্রথম রাতের ঘুম ) The beautiful girl looks more beautiful in her beauty sleep.
Bellwether (leader, দলের নেতা ) The police could not arrest the ..... of the rebellious group.
Below the belt (adv. unlawfully, অন্যায়ভাবে; adj. unfair and cruel or hurtful অন্যায় ও নিষ্ঠুর) Never punish your younger brothers and sisters below the belt.
Beside the mark (irrelevant, অপ্রাসঙ্গিক) What he has written is beside the mark.
Bid one's time (wait for proper chance,সুযোগের অপেক্ষায় থাকা) They are biding their time to make the attack.


Big bug (important person,গুরুত্বপূর্ণ লোক) The chairman is a big bug of the union council.
Big wig  (famous person, খ্যাতনামা ব্যক্তি) We were invited to a lunch with local big wigs.
Bid fair (have the possibility of prospering, ভালো কিছু আশা করা) He bids fair to be a good doctor.
Big gun (a leading man, famous political person,নেতৃস্থানীয় ব্যক্তি ) He is a big gun of our locality.
Bill of fare {A menu (=list of dishes/food) in a restaurant,মূল্যসহ খাদ্যের তালিকা, ফুড মেনু} He took a seat in the corner and asked the waiter for the bill of fare.
Bird's eye view (a rough idea, মোটামুটি ধারণা; a cursory glance, ভাসাভাসা দৃষ্টি, একনজর দেখা) He took a bird's eye view of the flood-stricken area from an aeroplane.
Birds of a feather (person of similar nature, একরকম স্বভাবের লোক) Birds of a feather flock together
Black art (wizardry,যাদুবিদ্যা, ইন্দ্রজাল) Does she practice black art?
Black sheep (person of bed character, কুলাঙ্গার) He is a black sheep in his family.
Blue blood (Aristocracy, Aristocratic/noble birth) He is proud of his blue blood.



Blue ribbon (Highest honour in profession, সর্বোচ্চ পেশাগত সম্মান; অথবা, the highest prize in a competition/event) The office of the Prime minister is the blue ribbon in political life.
Blow hot and cold (both to praise and to blame at the same time,এক মুখে দুই কথা বলা) I cannot take you seriously, you blow hot and cold with same breath.
Born with a silver spoon (born rich, ধনাঢ্য পরিবারে জন্মগ্রহণ করা) He was born with a silver spoon
Book worm (one who always reads book only, গ্রন্থকীট, বই পাগল) Don't be a book worm.
Bosom friend (intimate friend, a very close friend, অন্তরঙ্গ বন্ধু) Salil is my bosom friend. )
Breathe one's last (die, মারা যাওয়া) The old man breathes his last on Sunday last.
Bone of contention (matter of dispute, subject of quarrel/disagreement, বিবাদের বিষয়) The paternal property is the bone of contention between the two brothers.
Bring to book (to punish, শাস্তি দেওয়া) He should be brought to book for his misconduct.
Bring to light (make open, disclose, প্রকাশ করা) The inquiry brought to light some startling facts.
Brown study (fit of reverie, day dream, দিবা স্বপ্ন) He is now absorbed in brown study.



Build castles in the air (indulge in idle vision, আকাশ কুসুম রচনা করা; make improbable plans, ঘটা প্রায় অসম্ভব এমন পরিকল্পনা করা ) Don't idle away your time in building castles in the air.
Burn the midnight oil (study till the late night,অধিক রাত্রি জেগে পড়াশুনা করা; work late into the night, অনেক রাত অবধি কাজ করা;) You will not have to burn midnight oil before examination.
Burning question (matter of strong debate, তীব্র বিতর্কের বিষয়) The problem of the dowry system is the burning question of the day.
By all means (in all possible ways,সর্বপ্রকারে, সর্ব উপায়ে) Try to do it by all means.
By and by (soon, before long, শীঘ্রই) He will come here by and by.
By and large (mostly, , mainly, প্রধানত) People in our village are by and large farmers.
By chance (by accident, দৈবাৎ, হঠাৎ, আকস্মিক) I met him on the way by chance.
By fits and starts (irregularly, অনিয়মিতভাবে, মাঝে মাঝে) He works by fits and starts.
By far (out and away, in all respects, সর্বাংশে ) He is by far the best boy in the class.
By the by (in course of talking, প্রসঙ্গক্রমে) By the by I came to know that he was ill.
By hook or by crook (by fair means or foul, by any method possible,বৈধ বা অবৈধ, যেকোনো সম্ভাব্য উপায়ে) You must do this work by hook or by crook.
By no means (in no way, not at all,কোনোভাবেই না, মোটেই না) I shall by no means call on him.
By/in leaps and bounds (very quickly/rapidly, খুব দ্রুতগতিতে) The population of Bangladesh is increasing by leaps and bounds.

subject: English
question: The paternal property is __ between the two brothers.
description: bone of contention = a matter of dispute, object of quarrel, ঝগড়ার বস্তু

subject: English
question: The maritime boundary of Bangladesh was an apple of discord for a long time but now the issue has been resolved. What does 'apple of discord' mean here? / That piece of land was 'a bone of contention' between the two countries.
description: bone of contention = a matter of dispute, object of quarrel, ঝগড়ার বস্তু

subject: English
question: Although he has failed in the written examination, he is using __backstairs influence__ to get the job.
description: Use backstairs influence = use secret and unfair influence = অন্যায়ভাবে গোপন প্রভাব খাটানো ।

subject: English
question: 'The ambassador was bombarded with questions' means
option_01: The ambassador made bombs with questions
option_02: The ambassador was bombed to death
option_03: The ambassador was asked too many unpleasant questions
option_04: The ambassador threw questions like bombs
description: Bombard with questions = ask too many unpleasant questions, মাত্রাতিরিক্ত অপ্রীতিকর প্রশ্নবাণে জর্জরিত করা

subject: English
question: What is the meaning of 'Crocodile tears'?
description:
Crocodile tears- false sorrow- মায়াকান্না, কৃত্রিম শোক, প্রতারণামূলক কান্না। হৃদয়হীন ব্যক্তিরাই মায়াকান্না কাঁদে


Call a spade a spade (to speak plainly, অপ্রিয় সত্য কথা বলা, স্পষ্টাস্পষ্টি কথা বলা, উচিত কথা বলা)- I have no hesitation to call a spade a spade. স্পষ্টাস্পষ্টি কথা (উচিত কথা) বলতে আমার কোন দ্বিধা নেই।
Call it a day (Stop work, কাজ বন্ধ করা) The day is about to end now let us call it a day.
Call in question (doubt, সন্দেহ করা) No one can call his honesty in question.
Call to mind (keep/bear in mind, remember, ) I cannot call to mind your name.
Carry the day (win, জয়লাভ করা) Despite strong opposition, the ruling party carried the day.
Catch red handed (catch with the stolen articles/with proof, হাতে নাতে/প্রমাণ সমেত ধরা; কোন অপরাধ বা অন্যায় কাজ করার সময় কাউকে ধরে ফেলা) The thief was caught red handed.
Cats and dogs ('verb heavily, মুষলধারে) It was raining cats and dogs.
Cat's paw (person used as a tool by another, অন্যের হাতিয়ার হিসেবে ব্যবহৃত ব্যক্তি) He tried to make a cat's paw of you to serve his purpose. Politicians often use students as cat's paw.
Chapter and verse (exact authority, প্রমাণের নিশ্চয়তা) He gave chapter and verse for his statements in the book.
Chip of the old block (worthy son of a worthy father, বাপের বেটা) He is a chip of the old block.
Child's play (easy task,ছেলেখেলা, সহজ কাজ) It is not a child's play to walk this distance.
Chicken-hearted (timid, cowardly fellow,ভীরু) I cannot depent upon a chicken hearted fellow like him.
Close dealing (bargaining, দরকষাকষি) The man is considered miserly for his close dealing.
Close-fisted man (a great miser, খুব কিপটে ব্যক্তি, কৃপণ ) He is a close-fisted man.
Cock and bull story (absurd story, গাঁজাখুরি গল্প ) Who will believe your cock and bull story?
Cock sure (confident,আস্থাশীল)  He is cock sure that the business will be lucrative.
Cog in the machine (an unimportant person in a big enterprise, বড় স্থানের অগুরুত্বপূর্ণ ব্যক্তি) He is just a cog in the machine in our big organization.
Cold feet (cowardice,ভীরুতা, কাপুরুষতা ) He showed cold feet when the danger came.
Cold war (unfriendly relation, ঠাণ্ডা যুদ্ধ বা স্নায়ু যুদ্ধ) The two big nations are at cold war.
Come into force (Make effective, কার্যকরী হওয়া) The law will come into force very soon.
Come to light (become known, প্রকাশিত হওয়া) Their private talk has come to light at last.
Come off with flying colours (win, জয়লাভ করা ) Our school team came off with flying colours.
Cook the books/accounts (to deceive in accounts, নিজের সুবিধার জন্য হিসাবে কারচুপি করা) They tried their best to cook the books or accounts but could not succeed.
Crocodile tears (pretended cry, false sorrow,মায়া কান্না ) He shed crocodile tears at our misery.
Cry over spilt milk (repent falsely, বৃথা অনুশোচনা করা) They is no use crying over spilt milk.
Crying need (urgent need, জরুরি প্রয়োজন) Mass education is the crying need of India.
Curry favour (be favourite through flattery, তোষামোদ করে প্রিয় হওয়া) He knows how to curry favour with officers.
Curtain lectures (lectures given by a wife to her husband within the bed curtain/in bed, স্ত্রীর পরামর্শ) He is guided by curtain lectures.
Cut a sorry figure (make bad results,খারাপ ফল করা) He cuts a sorry figure in the examination.
Cut and dry (already decided & fixed, পূর্বেই মীমাংসাকৃত) No cut and dried policy will do here
Cut and thrust (hand to hand light, হাতাহাতি যুদ্ধ) They were involved in a cut and thrust for a trifling matter.
Cut to the quick (hurt, মর্মাহত হওয়া, কারো মনে কষ্ট দেয়া) I was cut to the quick by his words.
Cut someone dead (না দেখার বা না চেনার ভান করা) On my way to school I met an old friend of mine, but I did not have enough time to waste and so I had to cut him dead.

subject: English
question: 'Cupboard love' means__
description:
Cupboard love – show of affection – ছোট বাচ্চারা কোনো কিছুর জন্য যে ভালোবাসা দেখায়।

question: 'come to light' means__
description:
A cock and bull story = আষাঢ়ে গল্প, অলীক গল্প, গাঁজাখুরি গল্প, ব্যাখা বা অজুহাত দিতে যে গল্প বলা হয়।

Carry the day = win, be victorious, triumph

Catch a tartar = Meet a powerful opponent = শক্ত লোকের পাল্লায় পড়া বা মুখোমুখি হওয়া ।

Cut to the quick = be hurt, মর্মাহত হওয়া, মনে কষ্ট পাওয়া; to hurt intensely, কারো মনে খুব কষ্ট দেয়া৷

Call it a day = finish work, stop work, to stop work since enough has been done = যথেষ্ট কাজ হয়েছে বলে স্থির করে সেদিনের মত কাজ শেষ করা বা কাজ বন্ধ করা ।


Call a spade a spade (to speak plainly, অপ্রিয় সত্য কথা বলা, স্পষ্টাস্পষ্টি কথা বলা, উচিত কথা বলা)- I have no hesitation to call a spade a spade. স্পষ্টাস্পষ্টি কথা (উচিত কথা) বলতে আমার কোন দ্বিধা নেই।
Call it a day (Stop work, কাজ বন্ধ করা) The day is about to end now let us call it a day.
Call in question (doubt, সন্দেহ করা) No one can call his honesty in question.
Call to mind (keep/bear in mind, remember, ) I cannot call to mind your name.
Carry the day (win, জয়লাভ করা) Despite strong opposition, the ruling party carried the day.
Catch red handed (catch with the stolen articles/with proof, হাতে নাতে/প্রমাণ সমেত ধরা; কোন অপরাধ বা অন্যায় কাজ করার সময় কাউকে ধরে ফেলা) The thief was caught red handed.
Cats and dogs ('verb heavily, মুষলধারে) It was raining cats and dogs.
Cat's paw (person used as a tool by another, অন্যের হাতিয়ার হিসেবে ব্যবহৃত ব্যক্তি) He tried to make a cat's paw of you to serve his purpose. Politicians often use students as cat's paw.
Chapter and verse (exact authority, প্রমাণের নিশ্চয়তা) He gave chapter and verse for his statements in the book.
Chip of the old block (worthy son of a worthy father, বাপের বেটা) He is a chip of the old block.
Child's play (easy task,ছেলেখেলা, সহজ কাজ) It is not a child's play to walk this distance.
Chicken-hearted (timid, cowardly fellow,ভীরু) I cannot depent upon a chicken hearted fellow like him.
Close dealing (bargaining, দরকষাকষি) The man is considered miserly for his close dealing.
Close-fisted man (a great miser, খুব কিপটে ব্যক্তি, কৃপণ ) He is a close-fisted man.
Cock and bull story (absurd story, গাঁজাখুরি গল্প ) Who will believe your cock and bull story?
Cock sure (confident,আস্থাশীল)  He is cock sure that the business will be lucrative.
Cog in the machine (an unimportant person in a big enterprise, বড় স্থানের অগুরুত্বপূর্ণ ব্যক্তি) He is just a cog in the machine in our big organization.
Cold feet (cowardice,ভীরুতা, কাপুরুষতা ) He showed cold feet when the danger came.
Cold war (unfriendly relation, ঠাণ্ডা যুদ্ধ বা স্নায়ু যুদ্ধ) The two big nations are at cold war.
Come into force (Make effective, কার্যকরী হওয়া) The law will come into force very soon.
Come to light (become known, প্রকাশিত হওয়া) Their private talk has come to light at last.
Come off with flying colours (win, জয়লাভ করা ) Our school team came off with flying colours.
Cook the books/accounts (to deceive in accounts, নিজের সুবিধার জন্য হিসাবে কারচুপি করা) They tried their best to cook the books or accounts but could not succeed.
Crocodile tears (pretended cry, false sorrow,মায়া কান্না ) He shed crocodile tears at our misery.
Cry over spilt milk (repent falsely, বৃথা অনুশোচনা করা) They is no use crying over spilt milk.
Crying need (urgent need, জরুরি প্রয়োজন) Mass education is the crying need of India.
Curry favour (be favourite through flattery, তোষামোদ করে প্রিয় হওয়া) He knows how to curry favour with officers.
Curtain lectures (lectures given by a wife to her husband within the bed curtain/in bed, স্ত্রীর পরামর্শ) He is guided by curtain lectures.
Cut a sorry figure (make bad results,খারাপ ফল করা) He cuts a sorry figure in the examination.
Cut and dry (already decided & fixed, পূর্বেই মীমাংসাকৃত) No cut and dried policy will do here
Cut and thrust (hand to hand light, হাতাহাতি যুদ্ধ) They were involved in a cut and thrust for a trifling matter.
Cut to the quick (hurt, মর্মাহত হওয়া, কারো মনে কষ্ট দেয়া) I was cut to the quick by his words.
Cut someone dead (না দেখার বা না চেনার ভান করা) On my way to school I met an old friend of mine, but I did not have enough time to waste and so I had to cut him dead.

description: Call in question = doubt,, question, eft; Call to mind = remember, taken into account = consider, কোনো বিষয়ে সিদ্ধান্ত নেয়ার ক্ষেত্রে বিশেষ বিষয়, পরিস্থিতি বিবেচনা করা।

subject: English
question: "Call in question" means __

subject: English
question: 'Dead letter' means:
description:
Dead letter/ law not in force- অপ্রচলিত আইন যে আইন বলবৎ থাকলেও কার্যকর নয়; bad law- যে আইন বলবৎ রাখা যায় না, অকার্যকর আইন; Draconian law-অতিশয় কঠোর ও নির্মম আইন, old letter-পুরাতন চিঠি;


Dark horse (an unknown person, অপরিচিত ব্যক্তি)We were surprised at a dark horse like him.
Dead against (bitterly against, strongly, তীব্র/ঘোরবিরোধী ) I am dead against his proposal.
Dead beat (extremely/very tired, খুব ক্লান্ত ) I was dead beat when I swam across the river.
Dead language (a language no longer in use, not spoken,যে ভাষায় এখন আর কথা বলা হয় না, মৃত ভাষা) Sanskrit is a rich language, but it is now a dead language. Latin is a dead language.
Dead letter (law not in force,যে আইন আর চালু নেই/কার্যকর নয় ) The law is a dead letter now.
Dead of night (midnight, মধ্যরাত্রি ) The robbers broke into the house at dead of night.
Dead set (ultimate attack,প্রাণপণে আক্রমণ) The defenders made a dead set against the enemy.
Die in harness (die in service/business, কর্মরত অবস্থায় মারা যাওয়া) Dr. Sen died in harness.
Dog chance (a faint hope,ক্ষীণ আশা) He stands a dog's chance to be successful this time.
Do yeoman's service (render valuable service,বিশেষ উপকার করা; f; provide useful help,কল্যাণকর ; সাহায্য করা) Raja Rammohan Roy has done yeoman's service to our country.
Drug on the market (overabundant and not in demand, অনেক বেশি থাকায় চাহিদা নাই;; unsalable for lack of demand, চাহিদার অভাবে অবিক্রিত পণ্য, কাটতিহীন) This product is a drug on the market.
Down in the mouth (out of spirits, তেজহীন) He looks down in the mouth.

subject: English
question: 'End in smoke' means__
option_04: To terminate without producing any result
description:
Eat humble pie (appologise,ভুল স্বীকার করে ক্ষমা চাওয়া) He had to eat humble pie for his rudeness.
Eat one's word (take back, কথা ফিরিয়ে নেওয়া) I cannot eat my word for the fear of anybody.
Elbow-room (sufficient space to work or move around, চারপাশে চলাফেরা করা বা কাজের পর্যাপ্ত জায়গা) The factory is too small to provide elbow-room for its workers.

End in smoke (fail, come to nothing, end in nothing, ব্যর্থ হওয়া) All his plans ended in smoke.

subject: English
question: 'Fall into line' means__
description:
Face to face (in person, directly meeting each other, সামনাসামনি, মুখোমুখি, সশরীরে উপস্থিত হয়ে) I prefer to talk to people face to face rather than talk on the phone.
Face value (outward appearance, বাহ্যিকতা) Do not accept it on its face value.
Fag end (The last part, শেষাংশ) I have heard the fag end of his thrilling story.
Fall flat (have/produce no effect, cause no interest,ফলপ্রসূ না হওয়া) My advice fell flat on him.
Far and wide /Far and near (everywhere, সর্বত্র)) His fame as a scholar spread far and wide.
Far cry (long distance, অনেক দূরের পথ) From Munseiff to a High court judge is a far cry
Far and away (Beyond comparison, অতুলনীয়) He is far and away the best boy here.
Fair play (fairness, প্রতারণাবিহীন নীতি/কাজ) I believe in the practice of fair play in my business.
Fair field and no favour (impartial justice, নিরপেক্ষ বিচার) I want only fair and no favour.
Fair and square (honest,সৎ ও সরল) He is fair and square in his dealings.
Fare and fury (excitement,উত্তেজনা) When he talked with the rebellious workers, he added fare and fury in his speech.
Feet of clay (fundamentally week and coward, মূলত ভীতু) He appeared to be a strong and forceful man but later proved to a feet of clay.
Fight shy of (avoid, এড়িয়ে চলা ) Why do you fight shy of me? তুমি আমাকে এড়িয়ে চলছ কেন?
Fish out of water (in an uneasy situation, অস্বস্তিকর অবস্থায়; অপরিচিত পরিবেশে থাকার কারণে অস্বস্তি বা বিব্রতবোধ করে এমন ব্যক্তি) When he came to the village, he felt like a fish out of water.
Fish in a troubled water (take advantage of disturbed situation,বিশৃঙ্খল অবস্থার সুযোগ নেওয়া) He wanted to fish in the troubled water. (সে ঘোলা জলে মাছ শিকার করতে চেয়েছিল) [Jn. U. (A) 09-10]
Fit as a fiddle (in good condition,ভালো অবস্থায়) Though he has grown old, he is fit as a fiddle.
Flesh and blood (human body,রক্তমাংসের শরীর) Flesh and blood cannot endure such insults.
Fly in the ointment (a small thing that spoils everything,ক্ষুদ্র বস্তু যা সবকিছুকে নষ্ট করে) party was well attended but his absence was a fly in the ointment.
Flying visit (a very short visit,খুব কম সময়ের ভ্রমণ) He paid a flying visit to us last month.
Fly in the face (oppose directly at risk, প্রকাশ্যে বিরোধিতা করে বিপদ বরণ করা) Why do you fly in the face of the Principal order.
For good (for ever, permanently, food, চিরতরে, চিরকালের জন্য) He left the country for good.
From A to Z (beginning to end, প্রথম হতে শেষ পর্যন্ত) The statement is true from A to Z.
Foregone conclusion (anticipated result, পূর্বানুমিত ফল) It was a foregone conclusion that he would win the race. The result of the election/vote is a foregone conclusion.
Fool's paradise (illusory happiness,বোকার স্বর্গ, কাল্পনিক সুখ) If you expect any help from him, you are living in a fool's paradise.
Foot the bill (Pay, বিল পরিশোধ করা ) He asked me to dine with him, but I had to foot the bill.
Foul play (Treacherous or unfair act, অসদাচরণ) Be honest, do not indulge in foul play.
Free and easy (Frank, খোলাখুলি, মনখোলা ) He talked in free and easy manner.
French leave (being absence from duty without permission, বিনা অনুমতিতে কর্তব্যে অনুপস্থিতি) The boy was punished for taking French leave from his class.
Fresh blood (newly enthusiastic person, নতুন উৎসাহী লোক) I want fresh blood in the office.




Early bird = an early riser, যে ব্যক্তি সকাল সকাল বা খুব ভোরে ঘুম থেকে উঠে অথবা কোথাও আগেভাগে পৌঁছায়

subject: English
question: 'Free and easy' means__
description:

subject: English
question: "Fag end" means__
description:
Fag end = কোনো কিছুর শেষাংশ ; ধুমপান করার পরে সিগারেটের যে অংশ অবশিষ্ট থাকে, সিগারেটের মোতা ।

Some important idioms:

Face to face (in person, directly meeting each other, সামনাসামনি, মুখোমুখি, সশরীরে উপস্থিত হয়ে) I prefer to talk to people face to face rather than talk on the phone.
Face value (outward appearance, বাহ্যিকতা) Do not accept it on its face value.
Fag end (The last part, শেষাংশ) I have heard the fag end of his thrilling story.
Fall flat (have/produce no effect, cause no interest,ফলপ্রসূ না হওয়া) My advice fell flat on him.
Far and wide /Far and near (everywhere, সর্বত্র) His fame as a scholar spread far and wide.
Far cry (long distance, অনেক দূরের পথ) From Munseiff to a High court judge is a far cry
Far and away (Beyond comparison, অতুলনীয়) He is far and away the best boy here.
Fair play (fairness, প্রতারণাবিহীন নীতি/কাজ) believe in the practice of fair play in my business.
Fair field and no favour (impartial justice, নিরপেক্ষ বিচার) I want only fair and no favour.
Fair and square (honest,সৎ ও সরল) He is fair and square in his dealings.


Fare and fury (excitement,উত্তেজনা) When he talked with the rebellious workers, he added fare and fury in his speech.

Feet of clay (fundamentally week and coward, মূলত ভীতু) He appeared to be a strong and forceful man but later proved to a feet of clay.
Fight shy of (avoid, এড়িয়ে চলা ) Why do you fight shy of me? তুমি আমাকে এড়িয়ে চলছ কেন?
Fish out of water (in an uneasy situation, অস্বস্তিকর অবস্থায়; অপরিচিত পরিবেশে থাকার কারণে অস্বস্তি বা বিব্রতবোধ করে এমন ব্যক্তি) When he came to the village, he felt like a fish out of water.
Fish in a troubled water (take advantage of disturbed situation,বিশৃঙ্খল অবস্থার সুযোগ নেওয়া) He wanted to fish in the troubled water. (সে ঘোলা জলে মাছ শিকার করতে চেয়েছিল) [Jn. U. (A) 09-10]
Fit as a fiddle (in good condition,ভালো অবস্থায়) Though he has grown old, he is fit as a fiddle.
Flesh and blood (human body,রক্তমাংসের শরীর) Flesh and blood cannot endure such insults.
Fly in the ointment (a small thing that spoils everything,ক্ষুদ্র বস্তু যা সবকিছুকে নষ্ট করে) party was well attended but his absence was a fly in the ointment.
Flying visit (a very short visit, খুব কম সময়ের ভ্রমণ) He paid a flying visit to us last month.
Fly in the face (oppose directly at risk, প্রকাশ্যে বিরোধিতা করে বিপদ বরণ করা) Why do you fly in the face of the Principal order.


For good (for ever, permanently, food, চিরতরে, চিরকালের জন্য) He left the country for good.
From A to Z (beginning to end, প্রথম হতে শেষ পর্যন্ত) The statement is true from A to Z.
Foregone conclusion (anticipated result, পূর্বানুমিত ফল) It was a foregone conclusion that he would win the race. The result of the election/vote is a foregone conclusion.
Fool's paradise (illusory happiness,বোকার স্বর্গ, কাল্পনিক সুখ) If you expect any help from him, you are living in a fool's paradise.
Foot the bill (Pay, বিল পরিশোধ করা ) He asked me to dine with him, but I had to foot the bill.
Foul play (Treacherous or unfair act, অসদাচরণ) Be honest, do not indulge in foul play.
Free and easy (Frank, খোলাখুলি, মনখোলা ) He talked in free and easy manner.
French leave (being absence from duty without permission, বিনা অনুমতিতে কর্তব্যে অনুপস্থিতি) The boy was punished for taking French leave from his class.
Fresh blood (newly enthusiastic person, নতুন উৎসাহী লোক) want fresh blood in the office.

Fish out of water (in an uneasy situation, অস্বস্তিকর অবস্থায়; অপরিচিত পরিবেশে থাকার কারণে অস্বস্তি বা বিব্রতবোধ করে এমন ব্যক্তি) When he came to the village, he felt like a fish out of water.
Fish in a troubled water (take advantage of disturbed situation,বিশৃঙ্খল অবস্থার সুযোগ নেওয়া) He wanted to fish in the troubled water. (সে ঘোলা জলে মাছ শিকার করতে চেয়েছিল) [Jn. U. (A) 09-10]
Fit as a fiddle (in good condition,ভালো অবস্থায়) Though he has grown old, he is fit as a fiddle.
Flesh and blood (human body,রক্তমাংসের শরীর) Flesh and blood cannot endure such insults.
Fly in the ointment (a small thing that spoils everything,ক্ষুদ্র বস্তু যা সবকিছুকে নষ্ট করে) party was well attended but his absence was a fly in the ointment.
Flying visit (a very short visit, খুব কম সময়ের ভ্রমণ) He paid a flying visit to us last month.
Fly in the face (oppose directly at risk, প্রকাশ্যে বিরোধিতা করে বিপদ বরণ করা) Why do you fly in the face of the Principal order.


For good (for ever, permanently, food, চিরতরে, চিরকালের জন্য) He left the country for good.
From A to Z (beginning to end, প্রথম হতে শেষ পর্যন্ত) The statement is true from A to Z.
Foregone conclusion (anticipated result, পূর্বানুমিত ফল) It was a foregone conclusion that he would win the race. The result of the election/vote is a foregone conclusion.
Fool's paradise (illusory happiness,বোকার স্বর্গ, কাল্পনিক সুখ) If you expect any help from him, you are living in a fool's paradise.
Foot the bill (Pay, বিল পরিশোধ করা ) He asked me to dine with him, but I had to foot the bill.
Foul play (Treacherous or unfair act, অসদাচরণ) Be honest, do not indulge in foul play.
Free and easy (Frank, খোলাখুলি, মনখোলা ) He talked in free and easy manner.
French leave (being absence from duty without permission, বিনা অনুমতিতে কর্তব্যে অনুপস্থিতি) The boy was punished for taking French leave from his class.

description:

Fare and fury (excitement,উত্তেজনা) When he talked with the rebellious workers, he added fare and fury in his speech.

Fit as a fiddle (in good condition,ভালো অবস্থায়) Though he has grown old, he is fit as a fiddle.
Flesh and blood (human body,রক্তমাংসের শরীর) Flesh and blood cannot endure such insults.
Fly in the ointment (a small thing that spoils everything,ক্ষুদ্র বস্তু যা সবকিছুকে নষ্ট করে) party was well attended but his absence was a fly in the ointment.

subject: English
question: 'To flog a dead horse' means __
option_01: to fight for a lost cause
option_02: to act in a foolish way
option_03: to take interest in an obsolete subject
description:
flog a dead horse = take interest in an obsolete subject, পুরান কাসুন্দী ঘাঁটা, অতীত নিয়ে ঘাঁটাঘাটি করা

flog a dead horse = to waste one's efforts = আর করা সম্ভব নয় এমন কোন কিছু করার বৃথা চেষ্টা করা ।

description: Flare up = to get angry, be in rage, fly into a rage/temper/fury=রাগান্বিত হওয়া, হঠাৎ রেগে যাওয়া ।

subject: English
question: Appropriate use of "fair play" is
option_01: If you fair play, you can win the match.
option_02: He wanted a fair play in the tournament.
option_03: Play fair or you will loose.
option_04: I believe in the practice of fair play in my business
description: fair play (U) = ১. অবৈধ সুবিধা না নিয়ে বা অন্যায্য কোনো কিছু না করে খেলার নিয়মানুসারে খেলা; ২. ন্যায্য ও সৎ আচরণ, প্রতারণাবিহীন নীতি/কাজ । fair play হচ্ছে uncount noun তাই এর আগে a বসে না তাই অপশন b ভুল ।

subject: English
question: The meaning of 'To play fair' is__
description: To play fair = avoid cheating = প্রতারণার আশ্রয় না নিয়ে নিয়ম মেনে খেলা সৎ বৈধভাবে খেলা বা কিছু করা ।

question: A free-lance journalist is ---
option_03: a journalist belonging to the other country

subject: English
question: What is the meaning of the idiom 'a gala day' __
description:
Gala day (a day of festivity, উৎসবের দিন) The Eid day is a gala day to the Muslims.
Get rid of (to be free from, throw away, remove, নিস্তার পাওয়া) I can't get rid of this headache.
Gift of the gab (the ability/talent of convincing people, persuasiveness, eloquence, কথা দিয়ে রাজি করানোর ক্ষমতা, বাক্পটুতা, চোপার জোর) An advocate should have the gift of the gab.
Going concern (a successful business,সফল ব্যবসা) I am the head of a going concern now.
Gone to the dogs (be ruined, গোল্লায় যাওয়া, উচ্ছন্নে যাওয়া) He has gone to the dogs. সে গোল্লায় গেছে
Go/get into the red (incurred liabilities that exceeded assets, পাওনার চেয়ে দায় অধিক হওয়া,লালবাতি জ্বালা) Because of prolonged strikes and lock-outs, the company got into the red.
Greek and Latin (difficult meaning, দুর্বোধ্য) What you say is Greek and Latin to me.
Green horn (inexperienced, অনভিজ্ঞ) I cannot depend upon a green horn like you.
Green with envy (extremely jealous/envious, চরম ঈর্ষান্বিত; নিজের না থাকায় অন্যের কোন কিছুতে খুব অসুখী ) He became green with envy when he heard about my winning the lottery.
Grey matter (intelligence, বুদ্ধি, বুদ্ধিমত্তা) I wish I had a little of your grey matter.
